body: @BradWalker `#xx` means issue/pr number in the GitHub. So, should use another one.
Thanks for making this change Arunava, approved

@arvindaprameya sorry, looks like #2222 merging caused a conflict with this. Look like the same change.  Can you check, then rebase, squash and force push this PR to one commit and I'll merge.  Thanks.
@neilcsmith-net, @arvindaprameya  squahs is done, can be merged.

Hey @junichi11 and @matthiasblaesing, thanks for the feedback.. I would NEVER have known that GitHub was trying to parse my pull request for notification.. Thanks.. I'll be more careful next time.. 

Can @junichi11 commit my changes for me?

Thanks to both of you!
@BradWalker Never mind :) Merging.
@junichi11 Any chance to squeeze this change to 12.1?
@junichi11 looks sufficiently minor, so if you're happy for it to be merged, before next week for next 12.1 beta, please go ahead.
Hi! Any news on this? I really want Markdown support in NetBeans! Thanks.

OK, I'll look at it tomorrow.

@tmysik Never mind about the review. I'll merge this if there is no problem after I verify this tomorrow. Thanks!
Thanks to the both of you. :+1:
Cool, finally :). I had a look into the code, you removed a lot. So is this fix a general fix and will this work for those who not uses npm >= 6?
Also we should get rid of those hardcoded flags. But this is another task. Thx for your work :)

The `--parseable` flag was added to npm search around 4 years ago. Before that it was named  `--tab-seperated`. So I think it covers a lot of npm versions that people are actually using. 

This is a general fix for scraping cli output as was meant to be done.
Ok great. Thx for the info :)

The change looks good. The license reference is not needed actually. It just needs to be established, that the code was donated by oracle and oracle was in a position to donat. The license header is pretty clear, so this change is correct.
@junichi11 @neilcsmith-net Thank you.

> I left a few comments inline. One thing that needs to be added is a information file for files, that can't hold license information themselves. The files are an example. Please have a look at this sample:
> 
> https://github.com/apache/netbeans/blob/master/ide/editor.bookmarks/licenseinfo.xml
> 
> See also here:
> 
> https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/NETBEANS/Legal+FAQ (section "Per file info - licenseinfo.xml")

@matthiasblaesing  OK, I will add that file.

I will work on the changes and let you know when I am ready. Thank you for your time reviewing the code. If you have any more feedback please let me know!

@matthiasblaesing I would like to ask you something about the `licenseinfo.xml` because I am a bit confused. If I understand correctly the only entries that I probably have to add there are about the golden files used in tests. However, after searching the other `licenseinfo.xml` inside the project I don't see any `.pass` file included in there. So, should I add entries for the `.pass` files or not? What am I missing?
Looks good. Thank you.

Looks good. - Just in case you are not aware of it, it might be worth looking into:

https://github.com/apache/netbeans-tools/tree/master/convert

Maybe it can be  enhanced to make the work easier.
For library updates, could you please indicate, what you did to ensure, that the update does not break the build? (Were unittests run, was a full build done, were references to the files checked?)

Hey @junichi11, can you label this pull request with the "License" label..

I can't figure out how to do this..

Thanks.
Added testing methodology of this PR, from now on, I will put this info into every PR. Thanks for the input @matthiasblaesing
Reversed the specification version bump.

I've only glanced at this.  Is CVE-2020-13692 something that affects the IDE, and if so, does it need to be in 12.1 and backported for a 12.0 update?  If that answer should be done privately, please do so!
I'd also request that library upgrade PRs have some info on if, how and where "many bug fixes and improvements" are specifically relevant to NetBeans.  Are there any related bugs in JIRA, etc.?
Thanks @asotona At this point, I'm inclined to push this back to 12.2 rather than rush into 12.1, unless @jlahoda has another view on that?

Sorry, I forgot to respond sooner.

To run tests on JDK 9+ (and without nb-javac), currently the best way is:
-into nbbuild/user.build.properties put:
test.nbjdk.home=<path-to-test-JDK>

And into the given project's nbproject/private/private.properties:
test.use.jdk.javac=true

This should ensure the tests will be run using javac from the JDK.
Planned for 12.1
Is this JDK 14 not 15?!  I was just about to look at merging master to release branch for hopefully final beta.  What's the rush on this one?
@junichi11 Thanks for merging it! And sorry, quite busy these days...
@tmysik No problem. I know you are busy :)

Looks fine (and no impact) to me! Feel free to merge. Busy fighting other breaking things.

As an aside, should we be moving netbeans-linux to netbeans-tlp?

ok will merge
maybe we can move to TLP but a bit later (out of release preparation) in order to be safe
Yes, TLP move later not now, definitely! :smile:

Thanks @juneau001 @pepness 

Assuming retriggered tests are green, I'll merge into master for 12.1 beta2.
@tmysik Thank you for your quick review!
@junichi11 You are welcome!

A quick observation: I noticed that in the typescript editor the completion for paths in import statements did not work correctly for me. This manifested in the selector opening, but when I got on typing, I got a nullpointer exception. This is gone with this change, so if not anything else, this at least fixes a bug for me.

@jlahoda do you think this is stable enough to get into 12.1?

@vieiro 

> Just a quick question (don't have to do a thorough review, I'm afraid). Do you think this static final is going to cause threading/memory problems?
> 
> ` private static final TextDocumentSyncServerCapabilityHandler h = new TextDocumentSyncServerCapabilityHandler();`
> `

I hope not. The instance was no free-able anyway (it was added as a listener to EditorRegistry and never removed). And final fields should be safe to access from any thread (static fields are initialized under a classloading lock (non-static final fields are also accessible from anywhere after the constructor finishes, AFAIK)).
@matthiasblaesing - I wouldn't mind if this got to 12.1, but I can live with it not getting there. We can separate the fix for the NPE if needed.

Yes, the request is, semantically ;) but since there was already an indicator on the `response`, I added the flag method there. I though that an implementation would acquire data from the request (possibly leaving it behind), but I needs to have the response handy in order to accumulate results.

I can move the method, if you people  think it is really unnatural :)
@jlahoda Full speed ahead then!
@jlahoda @matthiasblaesing fine with me! If it's working, feel free to merge so we can get in next beta - waiting for a fixed nb-javac anyway.
Seems a sensible fix! Do you want to merge for next 12.1 beta?
This change will help the new feature "Sealed types" to work well when Open JDK 15 is released in Sep 2020

@arvindaprameya yes, that's my understanding, and the first release to officially support JDK 15 is meant to be 12.2.  This missed freeze on July 15th and still has open reviews, so I'm inclined to bump this to 12.2.  In my opinion, we need to get language features, including the relevant nb-javac support, in much earlier in the release cycle and well before freeze to ensure it's adequately tested.
For same reason as #2282 moving to 12.2.

@matthiasblaesing you added me as reviewer but not the 12.1 milestone - you thinking this should / needs to be done for current release?

There are multiple test failures. Have retriggered everything in case it's an infrastructure issue.  If fails again, please take a look.
Added 12.1 milestone to help tracking.  If you decide not to merge, please move to 12.2.
Added 12.1 milestone to help tracking. If you decide not to merge, please move to 12.2.

The testfailures are infrastructure problems (that is the main problem with our current setup a belief, that checks get only red when a failure was introduced and an unstable test setup).
The library definitions are useless and if someone adds them to their project it will result in the project being marked as broken. So I added it to the 12.1 milestone.

> @hectorespert could you please have a look at the spring framework change ([5c41416](https://github.com/apache/netbeans/commit/5c41416da1e32b9607e05a8d3a8c03524adfd422))

It's ok to me. But I don't kown if this artifacts are usefull. Seems that are sources and the pom transformed into jars.
Ok - there is a real problem in ergonomics (did I say, that I hate it?) - I'll look into it now.

Firstly, please take a look at #2272 - that is scheduled to be merged before next beta, and I think conflicts with this?  If it does and you want to merge that then rebase this, go ahead. 

> Ok - there is a real problem in ergonomics (did I say, that I hate it?) - I'll look into it now.

Did I say it too?! :smile:  I also wish the nb-javac and JavaFX installation support didn't utilise it.

> that is the main problem with our current setup a belief, that checks get only red when a failure was introduced and an unstable test setup.

Some of the tests are unstable, and network issues will sometimes cause failure too.  But they should go green with a bit of kicking.  Nothing that won't go green is being merged - it's generally a sign that something is wrong.  The lack of ability to retrigger single tests on GitHub is a pain - not a fan of moving too much away from Travis with that problem.

A crap - yes. I'm surprised we consider new modules in beta, but so be it. That PR is indeed a part of the fix. Once that is merged, I'll update this accordingly. I have change requests for #2272 which I'll add shortly.
Only considered because it seems a fairly minimal addition to Jakarta support already added.  Not an area I work with - so if there are concerns about it, it can also wait for 12.2!
@pepness  This is commit should do it: https://github.com/matthiasblaesing/netbeans/commit/a0cf9ea8300c761a4858ecae24651d4b94ba7299 - feel free to review and pull into this PR.
@matthiasblaesing  I just review your PR it did the work done. I re-build and re-test this PR and also check that the binaries where in place.

> I don't know the history, so the question might be invalid: should the jakartaee.platform module contain a revision number? I would expect Jakarta 9 to change and they might (or even have?) decide to change packages, so will this impact us?
> 


You are right about this, JakartaEE 9 change the packages names from javax to jakarta:
- [Jakarta EE 9 API Docs](https://jakarta.ee/specifications/platform/9/apidocs/)
- [Jakarta EE 8 API Docs](https://jakarta.ee/specifications/platform/8/apidocs/)

This is the [Backwards Compatibility](https://eclipse-ee4j.github.io/jakartaee-platform/jakartaee9/JakartaEE9ReleasePlan) statement for Jakarta EE 9

> 
> Backwards Compatibility
> 
> Jakarta EE 9 WILL NOT impose any backward compatibility requirements for compatible implementations to support the Jakarta EE 8 release. This is aligned with our goal of enabling new implementations to enter the ecosystem. However, we strongly believe that many products and tools will provide backwards compatibility and migration solutions for enabling older applications to run on Jakarta EE 9.

So I think the new module 'jakartaee.platform' should be renamed to 'jakartaee8.platform' and remove the revision number?
Regarding nb-javac, looks reasonable to me. Not only the library is not really working, but it is probably also not particularly useful (anymore?). Thanks for the cleanup!

> short usage example in the docs

Consider using [codesnippet doclet](https://github.com/jtulach/codesnippet4javadoc/blob/master/README.md) which is  integrated into NetBeans build system.

I do not have commit rights in the Apache repositories - someone else will need to merge.

I have another branch with patches to use this code running tests now.  The full test suites for lookup, filesystems and masterfs pass; loaders has one failure, but it is a test marked @RandomlyFails.  Tests in the properties module and a few other places that are affected seem to be unmaintained, and fail in ways unlikely to be connected to the patches.

Is the commit-validation suite still maintained / reliable?

Thank you for integrating and checking. For the version: Yes I think the name should contain the major version (that was what I meant with revision number in the name). If that is done, the doc artifact should also get the version number:

So `docs/jakartaee-doc-api.jar` should become `docs/jakartaee8-doc-api.jar` (feel free to reorder, the placement is just a suggestion).

@neilcsmith-net I dropped the jakartaee change from this PR as it is better covered in #2272  as you pointed out. The initial build failure of the nbjavac library issue was caused by a dangeling reference in the manifest to the layer file I removed, this was fixed. Both remamaining commits are reviewed. Unittests are green. Ok to merge for 12.1?

I see. I created [NETBEANS-4699](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/NETBEANS-4699) issue to satisfy Neil's request. I believe this PR can be merged. Can I do it now? It is a safe, compatible API addition.

Thanks, although I didn't say we needed a JIRA ticket, just that if there's an issue link it needs to go there.  Have added to title, which may or may not link things up - it's meant to sync.

Do we really need this in 12.1?  I'm trying to get last PRs synced for final beta over next couple of days.  We're in feature freeze, but not against this if it's problem free!  It needs squashing and force pushing here before merging though (GitHub squash and merge is problematic).

Is the API documentation correct? 

> if called before that ProxyLookup has been created, the lookup contents will be set during that ProxyLookup's constructor as if you had passed them to the constructor directly.

Am I missing something?  Doesn't it throw an IllegalStateException in that scenario?
@matthiasblaesing OK, feel free to merge. :+1:

> Am I missing something? Doesn't it throw an IllegalStateException in that scenario?

It does now, per Jarda's request.  If I weren't at this moment attempting once again to run tests against a sub-branch that modifies a bunch of modules (including the default lookup itself) to use this patch I'd fix it right now.  Feel free to fix in the meantime, or I'll get to it this evening, once my laptop isn't being brought to its knees by tests.

This ought to be perfectly safe for the current release - nothing uses the code without the patches I'm going to submit as a separate pull request once I'm sure they don't break anything.  I, for one, have two large NetBeans-based codebases I would immediately begin using ProxyLookup.Controller in if it were available, with probably 10-12 ProxyLookup subclasses that could be eliminated.
The continuous build failure looks pretty completely unrelated - an [NPE deep in javac](https://timboudreau.com/files/screen/08-09-2020_19-25-05.png)

Re running `ant commit-validation`, which I am trying to do with my branch that actually uses these patches - I do not know what to make [of these failures](https://timboudreau.com/files/nb-build-failure/) (that's a link to the html report).  Is the `commit-validation` suite unmaintained?  Should I have built a smaller cluster config than `full`?  This is hard to make heads or tails of, since none of them _look_ like related failures, but given that we're changing really low-level, pervasively called code in `Lookup.getDefault()` and `FileObject.getLookup()`, a second pair of eyes on it would be good.

The branch [in question is here](https://github.com/timboudreau/incubator-netbeans/tree/proxy-lookup-factory-methods-impl)
Modification done. Update images and the description.

> Do we really need this in 12.1? 

No, I just wanted to reward Tim for polishing his PR. Up to you, as release coordinator, to decide. 

The integration of this PR shall be safe. Only when we try to  [use of the new API](https://github.com/timboudreau/incubator-netbeans/tree/proxy-lookup-factory-methods-impl) we can get failures. That [branch](https://github.com/timboudreau/incubator-netbeans/tree/proxy-lookup-factory-methods-impl) is clearly for post 12.1.

> Is the API documentation correct?

It wasn't. I've done some necessary and some unnecessary changes in 316acb3 and 9e2f30f
@JaroslavTulach fine with me, but needs squashing into a single commit on this branch for merging.  You can do that, or I can do tomorrow before syncing up the release branch?

Assuming review complete, this needs squashing and force pushing here.  @matthiasblaesing you happy with requested changes?  If not, have to decide whether to push back to 12.2.

On squashing, better if you can do it @pepness but if the branch permissions are open (as default) I can do that before merging.
@lkishalmi just noticed the NB12.0-u2 label on this. If considering as an NB12.0 backport, wouldn't it make sense to merge for 12.1 if this is ready and not work-in-progress?
Commits squashed.

@JaroslavTulach I would appretiate a look at this. The title might sound as if this is a problem somewhere in the db support, but it can be traced back into the filesystem API (the compatibility module) and from my POV is the result of an incomplete patch implementation for the the extracted `Filesystem#getActions` method.

This would affect Ant projects that are created in NetBeans and rely on the NetBeans Library. 

In my opinion keeping the libraries up to date gives better quality to Ant based projects, there are cases that people can only use the libraries that NetBeans provide because they do not have access to the internet or the access is restricted, e.g. schools, banking institutions and government dependencies.
Sure :) Thank you for your review!
Thanks for handling the squash @pepness - merging now and I'll sync for beta 2.
Well, I just did not want to overload 12.1 with my changes. The code needs to be reviewed though, as I'm not sure if the technique I used is a common pattern for such a problem.
created another PR 2301

Very nice catch! Indeed, the Compat class was (conceptually) broken from the initial refactor. The issue was hidden until 9f47905f7 which removed the (now obsolete) `getActions()` implementation from the `BinaryFS` ... and even after until some old-API client was REALLY loaded at runtime.

So it seems that as a rule of thumb, the compat class should have ***no*** abstract methods in it. The `@PatchFor` processor could enforce that.

@junichi11 could you take a look at the beginning of the stack trace at https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/13009548/idelog-6.txt  Not sure it's the cause of the actual issue, but I've seen this stack trace myself at one point during testing,  Is it related to this PR?

From a quick check this looks as if htmlvalidator relies on CSS validator (https://search.maven.org/artifact/org.w3c.css/css-validator/20100131/jar). The old patch (still present as validator.patch) contained changes, that removed CSS checking if I interpret this correctly.

@matthiasblaesing ah, thanks, hadn't seen the old patch file was still there. Wasn't sure if the patch was the problem or a missing dependency with the update.  Guess need to decide whether it's a release blocker.
@neilcsmith-net @junichi11 this is an update/followup of 6debf7f90cf42e7dcac649cc6d55abf38ab678cc, which has reproducible problems (see the new unittest).

@neilcsmith-net Thanks for the heads up. Matthias has already created the PR(#2308) for that. I'll have a look at it ASAP.
@matthiasblaesing Thank you for investigating it and creating the PR.
@matthiasblaesing I'll test it ASAP. Thank you!
Closing this PR due to issues during squashing. New Linked PR https://github.com/apache/netbeans/pull/2310
@junichi11 Please review and approve your comments. I have addressed all your earlier review comment of PR2301 in this PR.
@junichi11 something had to break :-) Pushed an updated version, that holds the short license statement.
As I wrote before, I'm not an expert of this area. So, I've just checked code style.
@jlahoda Could you please review this if you can make time? Thanks.
But this seems to be changes only for GlassFish, what about the other servers (for none of them when selected could I see Jakarta EE being available in the dropdown below that).
